title: Molecular Basis of Drug Action and Disease Therapy
description: Molecular basis of drug action; basis of disease; drug invention. Topics may include: basic principles, autonomic nervous system; CV, pulmonary, diabetes, cancer therapy, pharmacotherapy of CNS disease (depression, etc.) pain, infections (bacterial, viral, malarial). Students that have taken both 255A and 255B cannot take 255 for credit. Prerequisites: BIOM 200A-B, 201. Limited to BMS graduate students except by consent of instructor.
